rules.text: We do not tolerate discriminatory behaviour and content promoting or advocating the oppression of members of marginalised groups.
We do not tolerate threatening behaviour, stalking, and doxxing.
We do not tolerate harassment, including brigading, dogpiling, or any other form of contact with a user who has stated that they do not wish to be contacted.

We do not tolerate mobbing, including name-calling, intentional misgendering or deadnaming.
We do not tolerate violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism or promoting the ideology of National Socialism.
We do not tolerate conspiracy narratives or other reactionary myths supporting or leading to the above-mentioned (and/or similar) behavior.
Actions intended to damage this instance or its performance may lead to immediate account suspension.
Content that is illegal in Germany will be deleted and may lead to immediate account suspension.

We do not tolerate spam, fraud, or theft in our community. This includes excessive cross-posts, links, and posts related to crypto/NFT projects and AI art (AI art can be posted under certain conditions: the post must be published as "unlisted," labeled as AI Art, and should not be profit-oriented).

⚠️ We kindly ask you to attentively read the information under "Registration" on our About Page in order to join our community. 

🔗 https://corteximplant.com/about

records.text: Having read the comic , I really disliked this last season existing at all. The story didn't need a "race the clock" story line. The story even more or less ends the same, but I think I liked the less child-friendly version more. There was more character development in single issues of the book than a whole season of this show thar should have ended a whole season earlier.
